name: Coimbra Group
goal: Founded in 1985 and formally constituted by Charter in 1987, the Coimbra Group is an association of long-established European comprehensive, multidisciplinary universities of high international standard committed to creating special academic and cultural ties to promote, for the benefit of its members, internationalisation, academic collaboration, excellence in learning and research, and service to society. It is also the purpose of the Group to influence European education and research policies and to develop best practice through the mutual exchange of experience.
interests: Competition, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, External Relations, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Higher education and research policies; inter-university co-operation and inter-cultural exchanges; facilitating knowledge transfer; promoting the role of comprehensive multi-disciplinary research universities and promoting the role of universities in service to society at different levels, especially their impact on local, regional and global development.
